content:
• Manage Distribution List
ID: 258401-789hge
Description: This intent refers to the  request of adding/Removing people (either users or owners/admins) to/from group distribution list (DL), mailing list, listserv, shared mailbox, mail group, mail alias, Microsoft Office 365 group, etc. Request to create or delete DL, etc.
Entities: [{ "dl_name": "name_of_distibution_list", "contact": "first.name_last.name",  "email": "email_address"}]

	• Camera Issues
ID: 1454909-745hgt
Description: This intent refers to help needed with the configuration or setup of the laptop camera or user is having issues with their camera or webcam during meetings.
Entities: [{ "laptop_brand": "name of the device brand", "screen_size": "screen size in inches",  "issue_detals": "description of the issue" }]

	• Performance Inquiry
ID: 223651-765dre
Description: This intent refers to any inquiries or concerns regarding the performance management system, PMD, SMART goals, goals, performance and development plans.
Entities: []

	• Password reset
ID: 2522751-763mkj
Description: This intent refers to a user's request to reset their forgotten or compromised password within a system, application or platform.
Entities: []

	• Software Access Request
ID: 266001-711bgr
Description: Refers to the requesting the permission or authorization or access specific software or tools within an organization. 
Entities: [{"name_of_software": "name_of_software_access_requested", "justification": "reasons_for_request", "duration": "period for which the access is required"}]

	• Hardware Request
ID: 2134451-754asw
Description: This intent refers to  request for a specific hardware
Entities: []

### Instructions for LLM:

Please classify the following utterance into one of the intents provided.  Also, extract all relevant entities for this intent. Each intent has its unique ID in alphanumerical format and description.  Some entities have slot names and value descriptions.  
Given an utterance you'll be provided, identify the intent that it matches best and extract all entities specific to the intent from the user input. 
Important: If multiple entities present, fill all the slots. If no value present for the slot, return "none" for this value.
 
Use the following format for your response:

{
    "intent": "<UUID> or no_intent if no intent is detected",
    "entities": [
        {"name 1":"value 1"},
        ...
    ]
}


My inquiry is about getting access to SQL workbench. I"m joining the project for 2 weeks and I will need this tool. I've got the approval from my manager.
